title: When is the Carabao Cup draw? Time, date and how to listen to quarter-final draw
text:
The draw for the quarter-finals of the Carabao Cup will see the remaining eight teams discover their fate for the next stage of the competition.

Oxford United and Colchester United are the only non-Premier League sides remaining after they overcame Sunderland and Crawley Town on Tuesday.

They were joined in the hat by Manchester City, Everton and Leicester City after they swept aside Southampton, Watford and Burton Albion respectively.

We’ll tell you what’s true. You can form your own view. From 15p €0.18 $0.18 USD 0.27 a day, more exclusives, analysis and extras.

Liverpool prevailed in a thriller over Arsenal, while Manchester United are there after edging Chelsea.

Aston Villa are the last side in the hat, having beaten Wolves 2-1.

When is it?

The draw takes place on October 31.

What times does it start?

The draw is expected to get underway at 8.45am GMT.

How can I listen to it?

It will be broadcast live on Zoe Ball’s Breakfast Show on BBC Radio 2, which is available on 88-91 FM, on your smartspeaker, or via the BBC Sounds app.

Who will be conducting the draw?

Legendary goalkeeper David James will be joining Zoe Ball to conduct the quarter-final draw.
description: The draw for the quarter-finals of the Carabao Cup will see the remaining eight teams discover their fate for the next stage of the competition. Oxford United and Colchester United are the only non-Premier League sides remaining after they overcame Sunderland and Crawley Town on Tuesday.
